H0.text: Erosion is the step in the rock cycle that occurs only in the formation of metamorphic rock.

H1.text: Compaction is the step in the rock cycle that occurs only in the formation of metamorphic rock.

H2.text: Cementation is the step in the rock cycle that occurs only in the formation of metamorphic rock.

H3.text: Recrystallization is a step in the rock cycle that occurs only in the formation of metamorphic rock.

A4.text: Metamorphic rock is found at the surface only where extensive uplift and erosion has exhumed rock that was formerly much deeper in the crust.

A5.text: Weathering and erosion break the original rock down into smaller fragments and carry away dissolved material.

A6.text: contact metamorphism results in a rock that is altered and re-crystallized by the extreme heat of the magma and/or by the addition of fluids from the magma that add chemicals to the surrounding rock (metasomatism).
